hints_html:
We can’t plug in the limit value. Factoring doesn’t immediately help either (if you try it you should end up with something of the form infinity times 0). What other techniques can we try?

Try rationalizing the numerator.
hints_latex:
We can't plug in the limit value. Factoring doesn't immediately help
either (if you try it you should end up with something of the form
infinity times 0). What other techniques can we try?
hints_raw:
We can't plug in the limit value. Factoring doesn't immediately help either (if you try it you should end up with something of the form infinity times 0). What other techniques can we try?
Try rationalizing the numerator.
question: 1 (b)
sols_html:
Rationalizing the numerator gives

\[\begin{aligned} &\lim_{x\to\infty}\sqrt{9x^2+x}-3x\\ &= \lim_{x\to\infty}\sqrt{9x^2+x}-3x \cdot \frac{\sqrt{9x^2+x}+3x}{\sqrt{9x^2+x}+3x}\\ &= \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{9x^2+x-9x^2}{\sqrt{9x^2+x}+3x}\\ &= \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{\sqrt{9x^2+x}+3x}\end{aligned}\]

Now we can factor the denominator. Remembering that \(\sqrt{x^{2}} = |x|\), we have that

\[\begin{aligned} & \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{\sqrt{9x^2+x}+3x}\\ &= \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{|x|\sqrt{9+1/x}+3x}\end{aligned}\]

As the limit goes to positive infinity, \(|x| = x\) and so

\[\begin{aligned} &\lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{|x|\sqrt{9+1/x}+3x}\\ &= \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{x\sqrt{9+1/x}+3x}\\ &= \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{x(\sqrt{9+1/x}+3)}\\ &= \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{1}{\sqrt{9+1/x}+3}\\ &= \frac{1}{\sqrt{9+0}+3}\\ &= \frac{1}{6}\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
Rationalizing the numerator gives

:<math>
\begin{align}
&\lim_{x\to\infty}\sqrt{9x^2+x}-3x\\
=& \lim_{x\to\infty}\sqrt{9x^2+x}-3x \cdot \frac{\sqrt{9x^2+x}+3x}{\sqrt{9x^2+x}+3x}\\
=& \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{9x^2+x-9x^2}{\sqrt{9x^2+x}+3x}\\
=& \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{\sqrt{9x^2+x}+3x}
\end{align}
</math>

Now we can factor the denominator. Remembering that <math> \sqrt{x^{2}} = |x| </math>, we have that

:<math>
\begin{align}
& \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{\sqrt{9x^2+x}+3x}\\
=& \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{|x|\sqrt{9+1/x}+3x}
\end{align}
</math>
As the limit goes to positive infinity, <math> |x| = x </math> and so
:<math>
\begin{align}
 &\lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{|x|\sqrt{9+1/x}+3x}\\
=& \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{x\sqrt{9+1/x}+3x}\\
=& \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{x}{x(\sqrt{9+1/x}+3)}\\
=& \lim_{x\to\infty}\frac{1}{\sqrt{9+1/x}+3}\\
=& \frac{1}{\sqrt{9+0}+3}\\
=& \frac{1}{6}\\
\end{align}
</math>
statement_html:
Evaluate

\[\begin{aligned} \lim_{x\to\infty}{(\sqrt{9x^2+x}-3x)}\end{aligned}\]

Or determine that this limit does not exist.
